column5: The Amazon Burning    Burning Over The Road    The Landing Pad    A Successful Mission    Finally On The Water    Camp    The Washroom / Showers    Super Shad Rap    Yellow Cats    More Yellows    Giant Taper    Another River Braid    The Angler & Guide Relationship    The Jau (Catfish) Hole    Another Fish On    Jau Heaven    Payara    The Winning Team    Patipitingua    Our Security Guard
Great Pics, what an adventure of a lifetime.
Now that's a cool report!  Thanks!  Sinker

Hey VG ... I knew you had more pics and I'm enjoying each and every one.  Kinda sad to see the burning of the rainforest there.  Less and less each year I would guess.   Taking a look at that Payara - that guy's got a very serious set of teeth there.  That fish could do some damage if he got hold of you.   A real envyous trip for ya and glad you're sharing it with all of us.   Will there be a Brazil #3 ?
Nice outing, thanks for the pic's...
WOW!!! That Payara looks ticked off!! LOL.  I dont think I'd even pick that thing up.  Awesome pictures....awesome adventure!
Just becareful that your security gaurd doesn't take a bite out of you!!!  my 2 cents  2many
Wow!!  Some amazing pics....thanks for sharing!  dk
Fantastic! Thank's for sharing, looks like an incredible trip!
Where are the giant critter pics?  Being in the Amazon you must have seen some wild bugs, snakes, leeches, something!?  Tony
That's awesome,talk about adventure of a lifetime..Congrats and great pics  Bassman

To answer your question Tony, due to the extreme heat in the Amazon (100C in the shade @ 8:00am) most of the critters sleep during the day.  As a result we did not come into contact with any unwanted critters.  The only undisirables were the red ants.  We sprayed Deep Woods Off on everything in and on our tent (including our beds) and fortunately they never got a bite.
Wow...truly amazing.. Amazon is burning... :S The colour on those fish are truly amazing!
